alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains; Far Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 7:42PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN MCKINLEY AND SAN JUAN COUNTIES THROUGH 830 PM MDT... At 741 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 12 miles southeast of Shiprock, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Farmington, Gallup, Kirtland, Bloomfield, Aztec, Shiprock, Upper Fruitland, Brimhall Nizhoni, Church Rock and Toadlena. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 1 and 33. Highway 550 between Mile Markers 123 and 174. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 1 and 83. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Blowing dust associated with strong thunderstorm winds can reduce visibilities below one quarter mile at times.

area.areaDesc: Chuska Mountains; Far Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau
